title: Bolshoi Performer Is Killed in Onstage Accident
description: A performer was killed during an opera at the Bolshoi Theater in Moscow on Saturday when there was an accident during a scene change, the theater said.

title: Brazils Covid-19 death toll passes 600,000.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazil surpassed the grim landmark of more than 600,000 Covid-19 deaths this week, making its death toll second only to the United States.

title: Man Who Faked Suicide to Avoid Covid-19 Fraud Charges Is Sentenced
description: Three weeks after he had been charged with trying to fraudulently obtain Covid-19 relief loans, David A. Staveley escaped by faking his own suicide, prosecutors said.

title: About 86 percent of home health aides in New York have met a deadline to be vaccinated.
description: The vaccination rate among home health workers in New York as a deadline arrived on Thursday for them to get Covid shots was about 86 percent, exceeding the expectations of some union and industry leaders and suggesting thousands may have made a last-minute decision to be inoculated, according to preliminary state data.

title: Heres how to watch and stream the Wilder-Fury fight.
description: The heavyweight title fight between Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder will be televised on both Fox Sports and ESPNs pay-per-view platforms in the United States, with a price of $79.99. The pay-per-view card begins at 9 p.m. Eastern on Saturday. And yes, its a bit unusual to have two big sports networks carry the same event, though thats one of the quirks sometimes present in boxing.

title: A Republican candidate for Texas governor cancels events after Covid exposure.
description: Allen West, the former Republican congressman who is challenging Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas for his seat, has suspended in-person events because he developed Covid symptoms after his wife tested positive for coronavirus on Friday.

title: Gen. Raymond T. Odierno Dies at 67; Oversaw Iraq Surge
description: Raymond T. Odierno, a four-star Army general who was an influential architect of the surge of American forces during the Iraq war that helped quell sectarian killings and increase stability in the country, died on Friday. He was 67.

title: Edgar Berlanga got a unanimous decision over Marcelo Esteban Coceres.
description: Edgar Berlanga, a 24-year-old power puncher from Brooklyn, settled in, survived a knockdown, and won a 10-round unanimous decision over Marcelo Esteban Coceres, using forward movement and heavy punches to raise a welt on Coceres left eye. All three judges scored the fight 96-93 for Berlanga.

title: Helenius led big, then won because of Kownackis desperate low blows.
description: Late in Round 3, Robert Helenius landed a right hand and left jab that buckled Adam Kownackis knees. The salvo was just the latest in a string of combinations Helenius had used to open a lead on the scorecards and raise lumps on his opponents face.

title: Atlanta Beats the Brewers at Their Own Game
description: MILWAUKEE  The Milwaukee Brewers won 95 games during the regular season largely because of the strength of their starting rotation and its three All-Stars: Corbin Burnes, Brandon Woodruff and Freddy Peralta. Only the Los Angeles Dodgers had a lower earned run average than the Brewerss starting staff.

title: Iowa Beats Penn State, Staking Claim Atop Big Ten Playoff Contenders
description: On a day that saw 103 combined points in two early afternoon college football games, Iowa and Penn State deviated from the days script.

title: Frank Sanchez wins in a battle among undefeated fighters.
description: Frank Sanchez defeated Efe Ajagba via unanimous decision in Saturdays co-main event to retain his heavyweight belt and undefeated record.

title: 87 Rescued From Near-Whiteout Conditions During Utah Ultramarathon
description: Kelcey McClung Stowell said she had been told to prepare for some rain and perhaps a tiny dusting of snow in the higher elevations before the start on Saturday of the DC Peaks 50, a 50-mile ultramarathon through the rugged mountains of Utah.

title: Deontay Wilders costume is lighter. Furys entrance is zanier.
description: Deontay Wilder continued the trend of entering the ring with an exotic costume. This time, though, instead of wearing a heavy armor set, he wore a red robe and red mask. The robe was accented with black feathers around the hood and a pair of silver wings on the back. Wilder claimed the attire he wore before facing Fury in February 2020 weakened his legs, contributing to the first loss of his career. This fashion choice is definitely lighter, so if he loses, that cannot be an excuse.

title: Quotation of the Day: New Yorks Black Pastors Urge Flock to Embrace Vaccine
description: The kind of conspiracies we saw in the past were real but they do not exist about these vaccines.

title: Corrections: Oct. 10, 2021
description: An article last Sunday about the safety of New York Citys new supertall towers misstated the occupancy status of Trump World Tower. It received a final certificate of occupancy from the New York Department of Buildings in 2005; it is not among a number of properties operating under a temporary certificate of occupancy.

title: Not Even Alabama Is Immune From College Footballs Upset Machine
description: Earlier this year, Texas A&M Coach Jimbo Fisher made a playful declaration.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SUNDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: As the Train Rattled Across the Manhattan Bridge, I Shut My Eyes
description: Dear Diary:

title: The 40-Year Mystery of Smutty Smiff and the Missing Rockabilly Bass
description: The moment he saw the standup bass in the Jersey City pawnshop, Stephen Ulrich knew whose it was. It wasnt just the jet-black paint job with the pink and blue trim that caught his eye. It was the word SMUTTY written across the bottom in big pink letters.

title: Kim Kardashian West Takes Aim at Herself in S.N.L. Monologue
description: When it was first announced that Kim Kardashian West would be hosting Saturday Night Live this weekend, the feedback was mixed  based on the reaction from some corners, youd think they had invited Elon Musk or something.

title: Abdul Qadeer Khan, Father of Pakistans Nuclear Program, Dies at 85
description: Abdul Qadeer Khan, a metallurgist who became known to Western intelligence services as the father of Pakistans nuclear bomb and a worldwide dealer in weapons technology, died Sunday at a hospital in Islamabad, Pakistan. He was believed to be 85 years old.

title: A Powerful Story of Coming to America, Finding Promise and Paradox
description: Why was America so kind and yet so cruel? Carlos Bulosan wrote in America Is in the Heart, his 1943 semi-autobiographical novel about a young Filipino immigrant bewildered by the paradox of his new home. Here, he found racism, callousness and brutality; but he also found good will, tolerance and generosity. Was there no way to simplify things in this continent so that suffering would be minimized? Bulosan wrote. Was there no common denominator on which we could all meet?

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1.5 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: At the George Washington Bridge Casino, Your Bets Are a Bike Ride Away
description: Towering majestically above the Hudson River, the George Washington Bridge is a remarkable feat of engineering to some. For others, it is a snarled, trafficky headache.

title: He Finds Women on Dating Apps. Then They Disappear.
description: If you remember me at all, you remember the shy, slight, discomfited and fatherless soul known to inhabit every little nothing town like ours, Wayland Maynard, ex-resident of Shireburne, Vt., writes to his former neighbors in 2020, in a confessional manuscript describing events that took place more than 40 years earlier.

title: Where Parents Have Abducted Their Own Children in a Bid for Custody
description: The men and women wrestled Wang Jianna to the ground. Holding down her legs and shoulders, they pried her 6-month-old baby from her arms and took off running.

title: A Year After Defund, Police Departments Get Their Money Back
description: DALLAS  The demonstrators came at night, chanting and blowing whistles outside the home of Mayor Eric Johnson, protesting in occasionally personal terms his staunch refusal to cut funding to the Dallas Police Department.

title: The Hot New Back-to-School Accessory? An Air Quality Monitor.
description: When Lizzie Rothwell, an architect in Philadelphia, sent her son to third grade this fall, she stocked his blue L.L. Bean backpack with pencils, wide-ruled paper  and a portable carbon dioxide monitor.

title: Finally Time for No Time to Die? The Champagnes Been on Ice.
description: One day before No Time to Die started playing in American theaters on Friday, Bollinger, James Bonds Champagne of choice, held a pre-screening bash at a swanky theater in New Yorks South Street Seaport. V.I.P.s in sequined dresses and tuxedos posed for photos on the red carpet, ate caviar and drank a limited edition wine dedicated to 007  both during the movie and for hours afterward.

title: The Sunday Read: The Perfect Villain for Voting Conspiracists
description: Over the past decade, Eric Coomer has helped make Dominion Voting Systems one of the largest providers of voting machines and software in the United States.

title: Vaccines, Child Care, Canadian Thanksgiving: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Week in Business: Facebooks Rough Stretch
description: Facebook had a tough week. On Monday, the companys family of apps, including Instagram, WhatsApp and Messenger, went down for more than five hours, disrupting communication for the billions of people and many advertisers who rely on them. (The company said several errors made during maintenance caused the outage). In an interview on 60 Minutes on Sunday and in testimony at a Senate hearing on Tuesday, Frances Haugen, a former product manager at the company, talked about what she believes is a need for more oversight of the social media giant. Ms. Haugen said that Facebook had purposefully hidden research showing its products negative impact on teenagers and was willing to promote harmful content because it caused users to spend more time on the site. She has also spoken with top policymakers in Brussels, Britain and France. Mark Zuckerberg, Facebooks chief executive, rebutted the claims in a note to employees, saying the companys research had been taken out of context.

title: Dodgers Turn Around Their Mood With Blowout Win Over Giants
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Almost always positive and upbeat, Los Angeles Dodgers Manager Dave Roberts was not after Game 1 of this National League division series. While everyone else raved about San Francisco starter Logan Webbs dominance, Roberts chafed. He wasnt bothered so much by the results as he was by what he viewed as his hitters undisciplined approach.

title: Can Crypto Go Green?
description: The cryptocurrency industry is growing quickly, as are concerns about its environmental impact. The original and most popular crypto, Bitcoin, is energy-intensive by design, mined by millions of high-powered computers around the world.

title: Richard Schultz, Designer Who Made the Outdoors Modern, Dies at 95
description: Richard Schultz, the ingenious industrial designer whose furniture collections for Knoll, the design laboratory that streamlined American interiors, are among the classics of modern design, died on Sept. 28 in Princeton, N.J. He was 95.

title: Major Climate Action at Stake in Fight Over Twin Bills Pending in Congress
description: WASHINGTON  President Biden has framed this moment as the countrys best chance to save the planet.

title: Pfizer will vaccinate entire city in Brazil as part of study.
description: In the southwestern Brazilian city of Toledo, you wont find much vaccine skepticism. About 98 percent of eligible residents there have received at least one dose of a Covid vaccine, according to municipal officials.

title: For One Bill Cosby Juror, the Work Did Not End With the Trial
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Electricity Is Restored in Lebanon, as Army Supplies Emergency Fuel
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Lebanons sputtering national electricity grid went back online on Sunday after the army provided emergency fuel supplies to the government, temporarily easing a daylong outage that served as the latest ramification of the countrys economic collapse.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Theyre prepping for Thanksgiving in Canada today, brining birds and peeling spuds for the feast on Monday, getting the butter tarts ready, dripping maple syrup into the cranberry sauce, setting tables, engaging in holiday cheer. Its amazing to think well be following them in just a little more than a month.

title: Does Instagram Harm Girls? No One Actually Knows.
description: Amid the pillorying of Facebook that has dominated the latest news cycle there is an inconvenient fact that critics have overlooked: No research  by Facebook or anyone else  has demonstrated that exposure to Instagram, a Facebook app, harms teenage girls psychological well-being.

title: How to Help Prepare Kids for Suffering
description: Last year, my sister was asked to write an article on how to make holidays fun for children in the middle of the pandemic. On a walk, we brainstormed about ways to celebrate without group gatherings. We wanted a respite for kids after a dark, hard year.

title: Dont Fear a Deafer Planet
description: In Deaf culture, we have a rich storytelling tradition, including a stable of myths passed down through generations of deaf people. One of these stories is about a planet called Eyeth, a utopic world where deaf people communicate freely and live without stigma. Rather than the audio-centric societies that dominate Earth, Eyeth centers the eye. In some tellings everyone on the planet is deaf; in others, the society is designed around visual communication and signed language, and everyone signs regardless of hearing status.

title: The Rich Have Found Another Way to Pay Less Tax
description: Congress tucked a provision into the 2017 tax bill that led to the creation of 8,764 tax havens across the United States called opportunity zones.

title: Abortion Rights and Trans Rights Are Two Sides of the Same Coin
description: Caitlyn Jenners run for California governor concluded last month, having earned her a whopping 1 percent of the final votes cast.

title: Sex Positivity, Pornography and Feminism
description: To the Editor:

title: A Street Basketball Mecca Gets a Face-Lift
description: As a child, Michele Roberts occasionally found herself at Holcombe Rucker Park when her older brothers, who were supposed to be babysitting her at home in the South Bronx, would take her to Harlem instead.

title: Its Not Sustainable: What Americas Port Crisis Looks Like Up Close
description: SAVANNAH, Ga.  Like toy blocks hurled from the heavens, nearly 80,000 shipping containers are stacked in various configurations at the Port of Savannah  50 percent more than usual.

title: After Killings, U.K. Asks: Should Misogyny Be a Hate Crime?
description: LONDON  As anger grew in Britain last week over the justice systems approach to violence against women, the public discourse has turned to a new question: Should misogyny be considered a hate crime?

title: Black Lives Matter, She Wrote. Then Everything Just Imploded.
description: CENTREVILLE, Md.  When Andrea Kane sat down to write a letter to parents in her school district days after George Floyds death in 2020, images of the Black man pleading for his life under the knee of a white Minnesota police officer were haunting her.

title: Review: The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra Returns, With Gusto
description: NEWARK, New Jersey  Since becoming the music director of the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra in 2016, the dynamic conductor Xian Zhang has worked steadily to reflect diversity and inclusion through the institutions programming, outreach initiatives and guest artists. This was crucial in a city where a majority of residents were Black and Latino; it also spoke to Zhangs own experience as one of a small number of Asian female conductors leading major ensembles. These priorities were in evidence on Friday when, 557 days after its last full orchestra concert (because of the pandemic), the New Jersey Symphony opened its new season at the New Jersey Performing Arts Center on a balmy night in Newark.

title: Go out there and enjoy Halloween, Dr. Fauci says.
description: Despite the wide availability of Covid-19 vaccines, not all Halloween parades have been safe from virus-related cancellations this year.

title: One Killed and at Least 14 Wounded in Shooting in Minnesota Bar, Police Say
description: One person was killed and at least 14 others were wounded during a shooting early on Sunday morning inside a crowded bar in St. Paul, Minn., the authorities said.

title: Iraqis Frustration Over Broken Promises Keeps Voter Turnout Low
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqis voted Sunday in parliamentary elections meant to herald sweeping change to a dysfunctional political system that has dragged the country through almost two decades of deprivation.

title: After 18 months, the Port of San Francisco will once again welcome cruise ships.
description: In the early days of the pandemic, a cruise ship that would become one of the bellwethers of the outbreak, the Grand Princess, docked in the Bay Area carrying dozens of infected passengers. It was one of the last cruise ships in the world to operate before the coronavirus caused a global shutdown.

title: Southwest Airlines Widespread Cancellations Disrupt Weekend Travel
description: Southwest Airlines canceled more than 1,000 flights on Sunday and just over 800 on Saturday, wreaking havoc on weekend travel plans for thousands of passengers.

title: What Have We Done With Democracy? A Decade On, Arab Spring Gains Wither
description: TUNIS, Tunisia  For roughly three months after Tunisians toppled their dictator in January 2011 in an eruption of protest that electrified the Arab world, Ali Bousselmi felt nothing but pure happiness.

title: After Whistle-Blower Goes Public, Facebook Tries Calming Employees
description: SAN FRANCISCO  At a question-and-answer session with employees last week, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebooks chief executive, was asked about Frances Haugen, a former product manager turned whistle-blower who had testified to Congress about the companys harms.

title: No Charges for Passenger Who Prompted La Guardia Emergency Landing
description: A passenger whose erratic behavior prompted pilots to make an emergency landing at La Guardia Airport on Saturday afternoon was not charged after the authorities determined that he did not make a verbal threat and was not carrying a suspicious item, a spokesman for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said.

title: U.S. Navy Engineer Charged in Attempt to Sell Nuclear Submarine Secrets
description: WASHINGTON  A nuclear engineer for the U.S. Navy and his wife have been charged with trying to share some of the United States most closely held secrets on submarine technology with another country, according to court documents unsealed on Sunday.

title: What the Malaria Vaccine Means for Africa
description: Like many who work in public health, especially in sub-Saharan Africa, Ive been waiting my whole career for a malaria vaccine. And even longer than that: I suffered from severe malaria when I was 10.

title: Democrats, Youre in Danger
description: The Democrats are staring down real danger.

title: Are the Jets and Giants Watchable Yet?
description: Time is a flat circle, but we want to help you break it. To that end, weve enlisted two experts  one familiar with the ins and outs of New Yorks football teams, the other a nationally focused football analyst  to answer an essential question as a service to readers: Is this team good yet?

title: A Coachs Vaccine Refusal Generates Discord at Washington State
description: PULLMAN, Wash.  With the leaves beginning to turn and the chilly air snapping skin to attention, Washington States football players awoke Saturday to a crisp fall morning. Walking into Martin Stadium through a gantlet of fans, parents, cheerleaders and a marching band only amplified their anticipation.

title: James Bond Returns and Theaters See Reason for Hope
description: LOS ANGELES  Movie theaters are finally bouncing back from the pandemic, with solid turnout over the weekend for the latest James Bond spectacle, No Time to Die, giving Hollywood its third box office success in the span of a month. For coronavirus-battered multiplex chains, its reason for a celebratory martini.

title: Review: In Herstory of the Universe, Ancient Myths Are Brought to Life
description: If not for the crowd gathered around, you could have missed her: reclining in the branches of a tree, as if dozing in her natural habitat, a woman adorned in feathers and tulle. At the brisk ring of a bell, she started to stir, arching her sinewy back, the beginning of a delicate descent down to Earth from her comfortable perch.

title: Wilder-Fury Yields Not Another Rematch, but a Path to a Unified Title
description: Late in the 10th round of their heavyweight title fight on Saturday, Tyson Fury floored Deontay Wilder with a clubbing right hand to the jaw, and the end of their brawl seemed imminent. But Wilder climbed off the canvas and spent the late stages of the round landing heavy punches as Fury covered up.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Vaccines were supposed to be the city-states ticket back to normalcy. But even with an 83 percent vaccination rate, Singapore is not opening up.

title: Put Off Until Later
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Happy Monday, solvers! Today we have an impressively constructed grid from Ben Pall. Mr. Pall is a software developer who made his debut in the New York Times Crossword nearly 12 years ago at the age of 14, making him (at the time) the youngest constructor of the Will Shortz era, although he has since been dethroned by the debut of the then-13-year-old Daniel Larsen.

title: There Is Shadow Inflation Taking Place All Around Us
description: Inflation has surged in 2021, with various official measurements of consumer prices rising faster than they have in years. But in a crucial respect, the data may be understating things.

title: They Were Promised a New Home. Then They Tried to Escape It.
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Its name translates into floating island, and for up to 100,000 desperate war refugees, the low-slung landmass is supposed to be home.

title: Austrian Political Scandal Leaves Europes Conservatives in Need of New Path
description: BERLIN  When Sebastian Kurz first became chancellor of Austria the whole of Europe sat up. Only 31, he had turned around the fortunes of his ailing conservative party and almost overnight become a role model for struggling center-right leaders elsewhere on the Continent.

title: Something Shook New Hampshire. What Caused the Boom Is a Mystery.
description: A mysterious boom jolted New Hampshire and at least one adjoining state on Sunday morning, rattling homes, spooking pets and prompting several hundred amateur sleuths to go online to try to find out what possibly could have caused all the commotion.

description: BOSTON  The pitching arm is extremely demanding. You cant just ignore it and expect it to work when you need it. Thankfully, though, it isnt picky. Just ask David Robertson.

description: Our NFL playoffs calculator has an up-to-date look at the latest playoff picture.

description: Continuing the good vibes from one performance to the next can be tough, it turns out, when you switch out all of your top performers.

description: Its something that needs to be preserved. You treat Rucker Park like you treat Central Park, the Empire State Building, Ellis Island, Statue of Liberty.

description: Errors are corrected during the press run whenever possible, so some errors noted here may not have appeared in all editions.

description: BOSTON  Christian Vazquezs night began on the bench. It ended with a triumphant jog around the bases.

description: To battle the nearly one-million-acre Dixie fire, California launched a military-style operation. Some experts wonder whether that approach is sustainable.

title: Whats on TV This Week: Home Sweet Home and Succession
description: Between network, cable and streaming, the modern television landscape is a vast one. Here are some of the shows, specials and movies coming to TV this week, Oct. 11-17. Details and times are subject to change.

title: The City of London Is Hiding the Worlds Stolen Money
description: In 1969, two years after the Cayman Islands, a British territory, passed its first law to allow secretive offshore trusts, an official government report struck an ominous note. A tide of glossy propositions from private developers, it warned, was washing through the islands. Cayman was fast becoming a state captured by shady finance.

title: Chicagos Crowd, and Its Offense, Comes Alive Against the Astros
description: CHICAGO  The first two of games of this American League division series between the Houston Astros and the Chicago White Sox were decidedly one-sided. The Astros outscored their opponent by a combined 15-5 and came into Sunday needing only one more victory to advance to their fifth straight A.L. Championship Series. The White Sox, winners of a weaker division, looked overmatched.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: MONDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Inside Rikers: Dysfunction, Lawlessness and Detainees in Control
description: When a detainee decided to hijack a bus inside the Rikers Island jail complex, little was in place to stop him.

description: President Biden has proclaimed Monday, Oct. 11, as Indigenous Peoples Day, becoming the first U.S. president to formally recognize the day.

description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: The Artistic Aromas of Anicka Yi
description: Six years ago, the artist Anicka Yi created an exhibition on a theme that now feels eerily prescient: human fears of viral contagion. After an Ebola case was confirmed in New York, unsettling city life and causing months of anxiety, Yi set up tents at The Kitchen arts venue in Manhattan to display petri dishes containing bacteria she had gathered from 100 women.

title: The Chaos on Rikers Island
description: Its Monday. Well look at the chaos inside the jail complex on Rikers Island. Scroll down and well also look at a privately run park in Little Italy that the city wants to evict.

title: Word of the Day: echelon
John le Carrs Last Completed Spy Novel Crowns a Career Attuned to Moral Ambivalence
description: SILVERVIEW By John le Carr

title: Samantha Bee Talks Marjorie Taylor Greene and the Trumps
description: The 45th president may have been ripe material for (dark) comedy, but Samantha Bee sure does not miss him. After covering Donald Trump for six seasons on her late night show Full Frontal With Samantha Bee, she says, Comedy is better without him. Just the world in general,  the globe  is better without him. She now has airtime to double down her coverage of other challenges like climate change and the affront to voting and abortion rights.

title: We Are Republicans. Theres Only One Way to Save Our Party From Pro-Trump Extremists.
description: After Donald Trumps defeat, there was a measure of hope among Republicans who opposed him that control of the party would be up for grabs, and that conservative pragmatists could take it back. But its become obvious that political extremists maintain a viselike grip on the national and state parties and the process for fielding and championing House and Senate candidates in next years elections.

title: October Isnt Just a Month Anymore. Its a Whole Szn.
description: October marks the start of myriad unofficial seasons: spooky season, pumpkin spice season, cuffing season, cozy season, hoodie season and, of course, decorative gourd season. (Or szn, for those inclined to abbreviate.)

title: How to Prevent the Worst Case Extinction Scenario
description: NASHVILLE  If youre a certain age, you may remember the snail darter, a small fish in the Little Tennessee River that caused an environmental firestorm when it was listed as endangered in 1975. At the time, the Tennessee Valley Authority was already in the midst of building a dam on the Little Tennessee. Snail darters require free-flowing water to reproduce, and the only known habitat for the entire species was about to be dammed.

title: This Drop Came So Quickly: Shrinking Schools Add to Hong Kong Exodus
description: HONG KONG  Long before the school year began, Chim Hon Ming, a primary school principal in Hong Kong, knew this years student body would be smaller. The citys birthrate had already been falling, and families were increasingly frustrated by Hong Kongs strict pandemic restrictions and the political turmoil.

title: Moving to a Crown Heights Apartment Allowed Her to Nurture a Green Thumb
description: Jaclyn Baird really wanted her desk to be a work space, but the plants have taken over.

title: As E-Scooters and E-Bikes Proliferate, Safety Challenges Grow
description: The coronavirus pandemic has upended many of the familiar routines that make up everyday urban life, bringing tectonic shifts in office culture, classroom learning and online shopping.

title: Theres More Than One Way to Play Dead
description: Gail Collins: Bret, October is my favorite month. And now that the Senate has decided not to default on the national debt, really, what could be better?

title: Inside the Courtroom With Theranoss Elizabeth Holmes
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  Three days a week, Adriana Kratzmann, an administrator, opens the door at 8:30 a.m. to Courtroom 4 of the Robert F. Peckham Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse.

title: The End of Gender
description: One of the biggest trends of the spring 2022 fashion shows that just ended was not any particular silhouette or color, but rather the fact that many designers put both women and men on their runways in what once would have been termed womens wear  not so much as provocation but simply as a matter of fact. Here, our two critics debate why, and what that may signify in terms of gender identity, sexuality and society.

title: Agony and Ecstasy on the Scottish Archipelago of St. Kilda
description: For the first hour or so, the water was relatively calm. After departing from the small fishing village of Stein on the Isle of Skye, we sped through a strait known as the Little Minch toward the main band of the Outer Hebrides, the thick curl of rocky skerries that hovers like an apostrophe over the northwestern coast of mainland Scotland.

title: Sydney roars back to life as pubs and stores open after three months.
description: SYDNEY, Australia  With excitement and caution, Sydney stepped out of lockdown Monday after more than 100 days of Delta-diminished existence.

title: Missing Apostrophe in Facebook Post Lands a Man in Defamation Court
description: A missing apostrophe in a Facebook post could cost a real estate agent in Australia tens of thousands of dollars after a court ruled a defamation case against him could proceed.

title: Which Towns Are Worth Saving?
description: The extreme weather and rising seas caused by the climate crisis are driving home an increasingly urgent lesson in the United States: An enormous infusion of money and effort will be needed to get ready.

title: Merck applies for emergency authorization for what would be the first pill to treat Covid.
description: Merck said on Monday that it had submitted an application to the Food and Drug Administration to authorize what would be the first antiviral pill to treat Covid.

title: Southwest Airlines weekend was plagued by cancellations and delays.
description: Travelers flying Southwest Airlines over the weekend faced hundreds of canceled flights as well as frustrating delays, with the airline scrapping about a quarter of all its flights on Saturday and Sunday.

title: The Nobel in economics goes to three who find experiments in real life.
description: David Card has made a career of studying unintended experiments to examine economic questions  like whether raising the minimum wage causes people to lose jobs.

title: Fighting the Dixie Fire
description: Wildfires have always been a normal part of life in the American West. During a typical year in the late 20th century, fires burned about 500,000 acres a year in California  an area equal to roughly half the size of Rhode Island.

title: The Ephemeral Beauty of Night-Blooming Flowers
description: BY DAY, HYLOCEREUS undatus resists friendship. A climbing cactus native to Mexico and Central America but now thriving in regions tropical and temperate around the world, it can grow more than 30 feet tall, colonizing trees and rock walls with extended, fleshy stems, massed like the arms of an octopus. All year it sprawls, a spiked barricade  and then, one night, the flowers come. Starting around dusk (depending on where in the world you are, how warm the day, the ponderousness of clouds), the pale, waxy buds, which resemble elongated artichokes, start to open, the pink-tipped sepals peeling back millimeter by millimeter until, by midnight, the secret is told: the blossom announcing itself, so white it seems to glow, with skinny yellow streamers at its throat. Its life is a matter of hours; in the light of day, it retreats and shrivels, a ball gown turned to rags.

title: Heres how to watch the Boston Marathon.
description: After being delayed by 18 months because of the pandemic, the Boston Marathon is back this year, marking its 125th anniversary.

title: Severe Weather Sweeps Across Southern Plains, Producing at Least Two Tornadoes
description: A band of severe weather moving across Oklahoma late Sunday and into Monday spawned at least two tornadoes and prompted a wave of warnings, a weather official said. There were no immediate reports of injuries or deaths.

title: Chucky Returns to Terrorize TV. His Creator Couldnt Be Happier.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: A Modernist Gem in Paris, Meticulously Restored
description: RIC TOUCHALEAUME WAS a teenager in the late 1960s when his cultured, peripatetic parents moved the family from Bordeaux to the Auteuil section of Pariss posh 16th Arrondissement. Now in his 60s, the prominent dealer of mid-20th-century French design spent those early days exploring his new neighborhood on the edge of the Bois de Boulogne, winding past recherch centuries-old homes with bisque stone facades and quiet courtyards.

title: Major marathons return in the U.S., with Chicago leading the way.
description: After waiting nearly two years for Americas three major marathons to return, runners and fans alike were greeted with back-to-back spectacles, with Chicago leading the way on Sunday and Boston picking up the pace on Monday.

title: Fight or Flight
description: Southwest Airlines canceled more than 1,000 flights yesterday, and just over 800 on Saturday, wreaking havoc on weekend travel plans for thousands of passengers. The cancellations accounted for around a quarter of the airlines scheduled flights this weekend.

title: KKRs co-chiefs, Henry Kravis and George Roberts, step down.
description: Henry Kravis and George Roberts, the private equity titans who founded KKR with Jerome Kohlberg Jr. in 1976, are handing over the keys. They defined the 1980s leverage buyout boom with the firms acquisition of RJR Nabisco.

title: Canceled flights and train delays: Were happy to have made it, some runners say.
description: Theres not much the pandemic hasnt delayed  Sunday travel to Boston was no exception. But some runners feared they might not make it at all.

title: In a first, the marathon begins with an acknowledgment of Indigenous land.
description: It was well before dawn on Monday when, near the starting line of the 125th Boston Marathon, the chairman of the Boston Athletic Association read a statement acknowledging that the marathons 26.2 miles run through the homelands of Indigenous people.

title: Evergrandes creditors consider their options as more payment deadlines loom.
description: Evergrande, the teetering Chinese real estate developer, has three more payments due Monday on its dollar bonds. Its been about two weeks since the company, which has $300 billion in liabilities, missed a Sept. 23 bond payment, starting the clock on the 30-day grace period before it formally defaults.

title: Underground Museum Looks to Philadelphia Curator
description: Meg Onli will join the Underground Museum in Los Angeles as director and curator, co-leading the museum with director and chief operations officer Cristina Pacheco.

title: The Hand-Beaded Chanel Bag That Takes 120 Hours to Embroider
description: The origins of Chanels classic flap handbags can be traced back to February 1955, when the houses founder, Gabrielle Coco Chanel, created her first pocketbook with a shoulder strap. Like most of her ideas, that purse, dubbed the 2.55 (to commemorate the month and year it was introduced), had feminist underpinnings: The strap allowed women to keep their hands free instead of clutching a handle. In 1983, Karl Lagerfeld, the labels longtime creative director, subtly updated the 2.55, replacing the simple twist Mademoiselle clasp with interlocking Cs, and would go on to make other modifications. The reinterpreted bag was named the 11.12, evoking the internal style code of Lagerfelds medium-size version, the A01112. But while the shape of the purse has remained consistent through the decades, Chanel continues to iterate its embellishments, capitalizing on the houses small specialist craft ateliers, calledMtiers dart.

title: What You Get for $1.6 Million in California
description: A Spanish colonial-style retreat in Chico, a Mediterranean-style house in San Francisco and a three-bedroom home in Los Angeles.

title: In Rolling Over Chiefs, Bills Encounter Little Resistance
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Before Patrick Mahomes even saw the field for the Kansas City Chiefs as their starting quarterback three years ago, he saw their future. Ignoring the organizations portfolio of postseason fiascos, its half-century of stepping on land mines, he assessed the Chiefs infrastructure  their inventive coaching staff, resourceful front office and nucleus of young talent  and forecast a dynasty.

title: Rick Hoyt, who became a fixture in Boston while being pushed by his father, retires from the marathon.

description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the space of just three blocks, hundreds of people packed in.

title: Bashar al-Assad Steps In From the Cold, but Syria Is Still Shattered
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  For a man who has spent the last decade battling armed rebels, being shunned in international forums and watching a brutal civil war dismantle his economy, the past few weeks have been good to President Bashar al-Assad of Syria.

title: $1.6 Million Homes in California
description: Chico, a city 90 miles north of Sacramento, is home to Bidwell Park, one of the largest public parks in the country. This house is less than half a block from the park and within walking distance of Sycamore Pool, a 1920s addition to the park that turned a section of Big Chico Creek into a concrete swimming pool.

description: Talking with the actress Maryann Plunkett recently, it was hard to know, at times, whether she was speaking as herself or Barbara, Mary or Kate  the three characters she has played over the course of Richard Nelsons Rhinebeck Panorama cycle.

title: Help Us Choose the Best Book
description: The New York Times Book Review has just turned 125. That got us wondering: What is the best book that was published during that time? Wed like to hear from you. For the month of October well take nominations, in November well ask you to vote on a list of finalists and in December well share the winner.

title: Roberta Gibb broke barriers in the Boston Marathon. Now theres a statue of her feat.
description: In 1966, Roberta Gibb became the first woman to complete the Boston Marathon at a time when women were prohibited from doing so because they were considered physiologically incapable.

description: All Tanisha Johnson wanted was for the pain to go away.

title: My Dinner With Andr at 40: Still Serving Hot Takes
description: Hear me out: My Dinner With Andr was the original podcast. Released on Oct. 11, 1981, this seminal art-house flick invited us to eavesdrop on 110-minutes of dialogue between two people who deliver hot takes and profundities that nobody asked for. And yet, My Dinner With Andr is just as fresh 40 years later.

title: Seeding Accounts for Kindergartners and Hoping to Grow College Graduates
description: Kindergarten often brings a flood of notices about events, school supplies and class photos. description: The N.H.L. is looking forward to easing back into normalcy on the ice and in the stands. After two chaotic years (and two titles for the Tampa Bay Lightning), the league will be hoping to crown a champion next spring without unwelcome pandemic-related drama.

description: DAKAR, Senegal  One of the most highly anticipated trials ever to take place in Africa opened on Monday in the capital of Burkina Faso, aiming to establish who killed Thomas Sankara, the countrys former president and a revolutionary leader renowned across the continent.

title: A Nazi Legacy Haunts a Museums New Galleries
description: ZURICH  With the opening of an imposing extension on Saturday, the Zurich Kunsthaus became Switzerlands largest art museum. The vast new cube designed by the British architect David Chipperfield, opposite the original building on a central square, more than doubles the museums exhibition space.

title: Amazon expands flexibility for some employees to work from home indefinitely.
description: Amazon told employees on Monday that it was loosening its plans to force workers to return to their offices, further retreating from a more rigid approach it had taken earlier this year.

title: Is the Race to the Bottom Over?
description: Economics professors like to stage a fun competition with their students to introduce them to game theory. It goes like this:

title: Deb Haaland, the Interior secretary, runs to honor Indigenous Peoples Day.
description: Deb Haaland, President Bidens secretary of the Interior, was among this years more recognizable amateur runners.

title: Clear Differences Remain Between France and U.S., French Minister Says
description: PARIS  As global finance leaders gather this week in Washington for the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund, Bruno Le Maire, the finance minister of France, made clear that effective French-American cooperation on an overhaul of the international tax system could not mask stark differences on China and other issues.

title: Alan Horn, a top creative executive, is the latest high-ranking Disney departure.
description: One of Hollywoods senior statesmen announced his retirement on Monday, adding to a startling changing of the guard at the Walt Disney Company.

title: Racial Bias Skewed Small-Business Relief Lending, Study Says
description: From the very start of the Paycheck Protection Program last year, it was clear that minority entrepreneurs, especially Black business owners, struggled more than white borrowers to find a willing lender. A new research project indicates that the problem was particularly pronounced at smaller banks  and human bias appears to be the main reason.

title: A Chicago Folk Hero Brings His Postseason Act to Boston
description: BOSTON  Before Red Sox first baseman Kyle Schwarber cemented his status as a big-game performer, he was just a high school senior trying to impress a visiting college coach.

title: Lawmakers Press to Rescue Afghan Relatives of U.S. Service Members
description: WASHINGTON  More than a month after a frenzied U.S. effort to evacuate thousands facing retribution from the Taliban in Afghanistan, members of Congress are still quietly pushing the government to help extract a small group of stranded Afghans who are direct relatives of American military service members.

title: Iohan Gueorguiev, Bike Wanderer of the Wilderness, Dies at 33
description: A truck barrels through a blizzard down a road made of ice. The road is so far north in Canada that at 10 p.m. the sun still illuminates the landscape, which is empty except for a few trees clinging to snow-covered hills.

title: Loans Will Be the Key to Banks Future Fortunes
description: As investors brace for underwhelming earnings reports across much of the business world, the countrys biggest banks are expected to report solid profits this week, thanks to the central role they play in the reopening economy.

title: Gin With a Hint of Mangosteen
description: Gin knows no boundaries. From its beginnings centuries ago, it has become a worldwide spirit distinguished by the presence of juniper. A new entry in the category  now riding a wave of popularity  is from Hanoi, Vietnam, with two gins bearing the Song Cai label. Each displays a different flavor profile; both are distilled with native botanicals foraged by families in rural communities that in turn receive support from the company. Only the necessary juniper is imported. Viet Nam Dry Gin, clean and lively on the palate, with a hint of lime leaf dancing with juniper, will flatter your martini. Viet Nam Floral Gin, fragrant and richly endowed with notes of mangosteen, cardamom and citrus, deserves to be sipped on the rocks. Each is 90 proof. The gins have been made since 2018, but are only now available in the U.S.

title: The Secrets of Pizza Perfection
description: Nobody can slice and dice a food topic, with vibrant photos along the way, like Nathan Myhrvold and his team at Modernist Cuisine. They have now tackled pizza. Are you ready for more than 1,000 recipes? Theyre in the three massive volumes, plus a kitchen primer, covering history, science, equipment, recipes, trivia, technical details, ingredients, innovations and culture across the globe. They explain how to flavor fior di latte mozzarella, suggest what to do with leftover pizza and how to troubleshoot. In a first for the books, there is a chapter on where to find what the authors consider great pizza in more than 25 cities, in the United States and abroad, the result of visiting more than 250 pizzerias.

title: A New Fuel for the Tailgate
description: Yes, its no longer summer grilling season. But how about tailgating or lighting the grill in the glow of early autumn with a new fuel? Agricycle, a company that repurposes agricultural waste, has introduced Tropicoal Ignition, effective charcoal briquettes for grilling that are made by smallholder farmers and women- and youth-led cooperatives throughout Africa from discarded coconut shells, palm kernel shells and cassava starch. The briquettes are completely natural, have no chemical ingredients and burn hotter than charcoals made of wood to quickly and cleanly sear those pork chops or slabs of eggplant.

title: A Bonbon With Benefits
description: These chocolates are the treat of the two Jacques. To benefit the Jacques Ppin Foundation, the chocolatier Jacques Torres has created bonbons draped in dark chocolate with a ganache filling spiked generously with Woodford Reserve bourbon, a favorite of Mr. Torres and a supporter of the foundation. The sale of each box of 12 includes a one-year membership in the Foundation at the commis level, which allows access to recipes and cooking videos with Mr. Ppin and other chefs. The chocolates can be ordered only from Oct. 12 through Nov. 12 and will be delivered in early December.

title: Pick a Card, Any Card, for Dinner Inspiration
description: Heres a cunning little gift that gives back. Maggie Tang, Alaina Chou and Amy Yang, students at the University of Pennsylvania, have created a deck of cards with food illustrations from 52 New York restaurants. The selection includes Adda, Carbone, Don Angie, Katzs Deli, Crown Shy, Olmsted and Via Carota. The project is supported by S. Pellegrino, Acqua Panna and Bentobox, and $3 of each deck will be donated to ROAR (Restaurants Organizing, Advocating & Rebuilding). Its a project of Gourmand, an organization Ms. Tang and Ms. Chou founded to inspire an emerging generation of food lovers with events, podcasts and other features; it has spread to more than 10 campuses. The cards can be ordered starting Monday and will be delivered starting in November.

title: Who Really Controls Local Politics?
description: In November 2020, Nithya Raman, a 40-year-old former urban planner, unseated a well-funded fellow Democrat and thoroughly endorsed incumbent named David Ryu to win the Los Angeles City Council seat for Council District 4 (CD-4). Its an amoeba-shaped area that encompasses the tony hills of Silver Lake, where Raman lives, sweeps down through the ultrawealthy avenues of Hancock Park, pushes out past the 18 high-rise apartment buildings of Park LaBrea, travels through working- and middle-class sections of the Los Feliz flats and Hollywood, runs up the Hollywood Hills and finally spills out into the suburb of Sherman Oaks.

title: Investing in the Future of Agriculture
description: Learn how Fidelity portfolio manager Steve Calhoun is investing in technologies that help drive innovation and productivity on the farm.

title: Bernard Tapie, French Tycoon, Actor and Politician, Dies at 78
description: PARIS  Bernard Tapie, a swaggering French businessman who lurched throughout his life from wild success to humiliation, knowing everything from high political office to the prison cell, died on Oct. 3 in Paris. He was 78.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Sydney stepped out of lockdown Monday after more than 100 days: Freedom Day, with rules.

title: We Suffer While You Debate: Many Fear Being Left Behind as Democrats Trim Spending Bill
description: [Follow our live coverage of negotiations on President Bidens social spending and climate change plan.]

title: Anne Saxelby, Who Championed Fine American Cheeses, Dies at 40
description: Anne Saxelby, a pioneer in championing fine American cheeses at a time when cheese lovers largely looked to Europe for such artisanal products, died on Saturday at her home in Brooklyn. She was 40.

title: Let Them Talk: Astros Spend a Rainy Day Discussing Allegations
description: CHICAGO  Before Game 4 of the American League division series between the Chicago White Sox and the Houston Astros was postponed from Monday to Tuesday because of rain, Astros Manager Dusty Baker, a music aficionado, was listening to a blues classic. The lyrics, he said, were fitting when he was later asked about comments made Sunday night by White Sox reliever Ryan Tepera, who suggested that the Astros were still up to their sign-stealing ways.

title: The 2021 Restaurant List
description: The 50 places in America were most excited about right now.

title: Havent Watched Squid Game? Heres What Youre Not Missing.
description: This notebook contains spoilers.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Moderna has been supplying its coronavirus vaccine almost exclusively to wealthy nations, keeping poorer countries waiting while it earns billions in profit.

title: Doing Economics as if Evidence Matters
description: Nobel Memorial Prizes in economics are given for long-term research, not for economists role in current debates, so they dont necessarily have much bearing on the political moment. You might expect the disconnect to be especially strong when the prize is given mainly for the development of new research methods.

title: Police Officer Drags Man by Hair From Car. Im Paraplegic, He Protests.
description: A Black man who was pulled from a car by police officers while yelling Im paraplegic filed a complaint with the N.A.A.C.P., the organization said, as the police in Dayton, Ohio, said they were investigating what had happened during the stop.

title: A W.H.O. panel recommends additional vaccine doses for immunocompromised people.
description: Severely or moderately immunocompromised people who have been vaccinated should be offered an additional dose of the seven coronavirus vaccines the World Health Organization has authorized, an advisory committee recommended on Monday.

title: Florida City Sued Over Mural Depicting First Black Female Firefighter as White
description: The city had never had a Black woman as a firefighter before Latosha Clemons, but last year when she glimpsed a publicly commissioned mural depicting her, she said, she didnt recognize herself: She was white.

title: Boosters, Hong Kong, Boston Marathon: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: After a Long Wait, the Boston Marathon Returns as a Fall Classic
description: BOSTON  After running more than 26 miles through the streets of greater Boston on Monday, Edna Havlin, a marathoner from Brazil, threw her arms up as she crossed the finish line. Were back! she shouted as spectators cheered.

title: In Iraq Election, Shiite Cleric Who Fought U.S. Strengthens Power
description: BAGHDAD  Followers of a Shiite cleric whose fighters battled U.S. forces during the occupation made the biggest gains in Iraqs parliamentary election, strengthening his hand in determining whether the country drifts further out of the American orbit.

title: Netflix employee who criticized Dave Chappelles comedy special is among three suspended.
description: Netflix recently suspended three employees, including a transgender employee who posted a Twitter thread last week criticizing a new Dave Chappelle stand-up special on the streaming service as being transphobic.

title: Im Just Overjoyed: Boston Marathon Racers Rejoice After Lost Year
description: Thousands of competitors ran the 2021 Boston Marathon. The prestigious race restarted this year after being canceled in 2020 because of the pandemic.

title: Mr. Joctober: Pedersons Blast Was all the Offense Atlanta Needed
description: Only one division series this fall is truly a clash of the luckless. The Milwaukee Brewers have not reached the World Series in nearly four decades, and have never won a championship. Atlanta has gone 26 years without a title, and has not won a pennant in the 21st century.

title: Bidens Proposal to Empower I.R.S. Rattles Banks and Their Customers
description: When the Biden administration looked for ways to pay for the presidents expansive social policy bill, it proposed raising revenue by cracking down on $7 trillion in unpaid taxes, mostly from wealthy Americans and businesses.

title: Matt Amodios Jeopardy! Streak Ends After 38 Wins
description: Ken Jennings can relax.

title: Video Shows Police Pulling Man Out of Car by Hair During Traffic Stop
description: Police body camera footage showed officers in Dayton, Ohio, dragging Clifford Owensby out of his car as he yelled, Im paraplegic. Mr. Owensby has filed a complaint with the N.A.A.C.P.

title: A Babysitter and a Band-Aid Wrapper: Inside the Submarine Spy Case
description: WASHINGTON  On July 28, Diana Toebbe posted a Facebook message looking for a babysitter to take care of her children early on the coming Saturday morning for five to six hours.

title: Election Workers in Georgia Are Fired for Shredding Voter Registration Forms
description: The elections office in Georgias heavily Democratic Fulton County said on Monday that two workers had been fired for shredding voter registration forms, most likely adding fuel to a Republican-led investigation of the office that critics call politically motivated.

title: Raiders Coach Resigns After Homophobic and Misogynistic Emails
description: Jon Gruden stepped down Monday as the coach of the Las Vegas Raiders football team hours after The New York Times detailed emails in which he had made homophobic and misogynistic remarks, following an earlier report of racist statements about a union leader.

title: Is This a Room Review: A Transcript Becomes a Thrilling Thriller
description: Short of grocery lists, raw transcripts may be the most boring things ever written. With their halts and hesitations and dust bunnies of fuzzy logic, they beg to be thoroughly tidied before use, and disposed of quickly after.

title: The governor of Texas bars Covid vaccine mandates.
description: Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas issued a broad executive order on Monday that bars virtually any coronavirus vaccine mandate in the state.

title: Miami Will Fire Police Chief Who Likened Leaders to Cuban Dictators
description: MIAMI  Back in March, when Mayor Francis Suarez of Miami revealed that the city would bring on Art Acevedo, the Houston police chief, to head its Police Department, Mr. Suarez told the local newspaper that the hire was like getting the Tom Brady or the Michael Jordan of police chiefs.

title: Players on N.H.L.s newest team are sidelined by Covid protocols before debut.
description: The Seattle Kraken have yet to play a game in the National Hockey League. On the eve of their debut, five players have already been sidelined by an implacable foe: the leagues Covid-19 protocols.

title: Louisiana State Police Did Not Discover Trooper Had Been Killed for Half a Day
description: A Louisiana man was arrested over the weekend in a series of shootings that left two people dead, including a state trooper whose death was not discovered for more than 12 hours after he was shot, the authorities said.

title: Cause for a Correction
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Congratulations to todays constructor, Conor Sefkow, for making his New York Times Crossword debut! This puzzle is built around a term that Mr. Sefkow coined himself and just knew he had to build a puzzle around. I love hearing the origin stories of creative themes like this one (described in more detail below), and I am particularly fond of clever portmanteaus, which, as far as Im concerned, are the height of wit.

title: Kristalina Georgieva will remain managing director of the I.M.F., its board says.
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Funds executive board on Monday expressed confidence in the leadership of Kristalina Georgieva, its managing director, after allegations that she manipulated data to placate China when she was a senior World Bank official.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Thirty-two countries have joined the U.S. in a pact developed with the E.U. to reduce methane emissions 30 percent by 2030. It is part of an effort to set new targets to slow global warming before a major U.N. climate summit in Glasgow next month.

title: Quotation of the Day: The Large and Costly Battle to Contain a Megafire
description: Fifteen years ago, a 100,000-acre fire would be the largest fire of your career. Now, we have one-million-acre fires. Were the size of Rhode Island, working toward Delaware.

title: Susan Orlean Has an Eye for the Little Creatures
description: ON ANIMALSBy Susan Orlean

title: Corrections: Oct. 12, 2021
description: The Saturday Profile about Lamont Marcell Jacobs, the Italian sprinter who won two gold medals in the Tokyo Olympics, misstated Italys medal count in athletics events, which include track and field, at the games. The country won five gold medals in athletics events, not 10.

title: North Korea Displays Large Missile Arsenal Amid Stalled Talks
description: SEOUL  North Korea on Monday showed off its growing arsenal of missiles in one of its largest-ever exhibitions of military gear, as its leader, Kim Jong-un, said he didnt believe repeated assertions by the United States that it harbored no hostile intent toward his country.

title: Seth Meyers Muses on Trumps Weekend Iowa Rally
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: If Youve Had Covid, Do You Need the Vaccine?
description: When Jonathan Isaac, a prominent basketball player for the Orlando Magic, explained why he chose not to be vaccinated against the coronavirus, he tapped into a dispute that has been simmering for months: Do people who have had Covid-19, as Mr. Isaac said he has, really need the vaccine?

title: Past Pandemics Remind Us Covid Will Be an Era, Not a Crisis That Fades
description: The skeletons move across a barren landscape toward the few helpless and terrified people still living. The scene, imagined in a mid-16th-century painting, The Triumph of Death by Pieter Bruegel the Elder, illuminated the psychic impact of the bubonic plague.

title: Old Glory
description: For nearly 250 years, the American flag has been made and remade.  A recent Times article showcased several new updates to the flag, as imagined by six artists and graphic designers.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: TUESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.

title: Trumps Shadow Looms as Lev Parnas Trial Begins in New York
description: For Lev Parnas, a Ukrainian American businessman living in Florida, 2018 was a busy year.

title: What the Future May Hold for the Coronavirus and Us
description: On Jan. 9, 2020, about a week after the world first learned of a mysterious cluster of pneumonia cases in central China, authorities announced that scientists had found the culprit: a novel coronavirus.

title: The Red Sox Ride a Wave of Offense Into the A.L.C.S.
description: BOSTON  So this was how it ended for the Tampa Bay Rays, the team that pushes and pokes conventional thinking and usually gets away with it. The Rays set a franchise record with 100 victories this season, eight more than the Boston Red Sox. But when it mattered most, in their American League division series, the Red Sox upended the hoariest axiom of all.

title: Lesson of the Day: How an 11-Foot-Tall 3-D Printer Is Helping to Create a Community
description: Featured Article: How an 11-Foot-Tall 3-D Printer Is Helping to Create a Community by Debra Kamin

title: On a Windy Night in L.A., One Run Is Enough for the Giants
description: LOS ANGELES  It wasnt only the unusually windy evening that gave Southern California a chilly, blustery San Francisco feel on Monday. It also was that rare night when the Los Angeles Dodgers embarrassment of riches, and constant need to upgrade, unexpectedly bit them.

title: More E-Scooters, More E-Bikes and More Safety Concerns
description: Its Tuesday. Well look at how e-scooters and e-bikes have changed the streetscape in New York and raised safety concerns. Scroll down and well look at a professor who won a $1 million prize for real-world projects, including an algorithm to predict manhole explosions.

title: Takeover
description: On July 14, 1970, members of the Young Lords took over Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx. Among their demands? Accessible, quality health care for all.

title: Should Greek Life on College Campuses Come to an End?
description: Do you have siblings or other relatives who are, or once were, members of sororities and fraternities? Is Greek life something youve always imagined youll be a part of when you attend college?

title: An Investigation Into a Virgin Birth Upends Lives in This Sly English Novel
description: SMALL PLEASURESBy Clare Chambers

title: How to Play Drunk
description: Acting drunk convincingly is about the hardest thing you can do, says D.W. Brown, 60, an acting coach based in Santa Monica, Calif., who has worked with both film and stage actors. There are famous film scenes for which actors are said to have drunk alcohol, but getting intoxicated for real is ill advised, especially for stage actors, who perform the same scene day after day. Figure out how to fake it instead, which will require practiced motor-skill impairment and discernible psychological shifts.

title: Diane Williams Navigates the Tricky Business of Intimacy
description: HOW HIGH?  THAT HIGHStoriesBy Diane Williams

title: A Memoir of Filipino American Family Life in the Wake of Colonialism
description: CONCEPCIONAn Immigrant Familys FortunesBy Albert Samaha

title: Victoria Changs Dear Memory Is a Multimedia Exploration of Grief
description: DEAR MEMORYLetters on Writing, Silence, and GriefBy Victoria Chang

title: Zen and the Art of Printer Maintenance
description: LASERWRITER IIBy Tamara Shopsin

title: A Memoir of Post-Genocide Refugee Life Rendered With Delicacy and Insight
description: THOSE WE THROW AWAY ARE DIAMONDSA Refugees Search for HomeBy Mondiant Dogon with Jenna Krajeski

title: When a Factory Relocates to Mexico, What Happens to Its American Workers?
description: AMERICAN MADEWhat Happens to People When Work DisappearsBy Farah Stockman

title: Cursed for Life? Not So Fast, Say Alice Hoffmans Witches
description: THE BOOK OF MAGICBy Alice Hoffman

title: The Park Bench Is an Endangered Species
description: As a kid growing up in a gray suburb of London, I loved to go looking for the perfect park bench. We had only five in our local park, and one was broken. Some Sunday mornings, my dad could be persuaded to drive to new parks. Wed have a kick-around with a soccer ball, share a bag of Doritos and check out all the benches in the area, reading their dedications, inscriptions and graffiti.

title: He Read All 27,000 Marvel Comic Books and Lived to Tell the Tale
description: ALL OF THE MARVELSA Journey to the Ends of the Biggest Story Ever ToldBy Douglas Wolk

title: Was My Black Colleague Right to Skip Our Firms Recruitment Event?
description: I lead a department within a medium-size company, where weve had a lot of discussions about making our hiring practices more inclusive. Although we do well on the gender front, we are about 85 percent white. Our motives for pursuing more diversity are somewhat altruistic  we pay very well, so hiring minorities makes a small contribution to evening out the wealth gap  but also business-related, as our client base is becoming increasingly diverse, and a more diverse work force might help us to better meet their needs.

title: There Are Better Riches Than Commerce and Other Lessons From Nick Offerman
description: Nick Offerman is best known for his role as Ron Swanson, the mustachioed, libertarian outdoorsman who led the Pawnee, Ind., Parks and Recreation Department on the beloved show Parks and Recreation. But theres more to Offerman than Swanson: His new book, Where the Deer and the Antelope Play, was inspired in part by his conversation with the agrarian poet-philosopher Wendell Berry, and a hiking trip he took with the writer George Saunders and the musician Jeff Tweedy (both of whom you may remember from past episodes of this show).

title: How Democrats Can Save Themselves
description: Normally the political party that loses an election goes through a period of soul-searching and vigorous internal debate, while the winning party embraces a smug certainty about its own inevitable multigenerational dominance. In 2021, though, the roles are reversed.

title: Alex Ovechkin Can See Wayne Gretzkys N.H.L. Goals Record
description: When you think of the great goal-scorers in N.H.L. history, you think first of Wayne Gretzky. Names like Gordie Howe and Jaromir Jagr might come to mind, too.

title: The Hospital Occupation That Changed Public Health Care
description: On July 14, 1970, members of the Young Lords occupied Lincoln Hospital in the South Bronx  known locally as the Butcher Shop. A group of activists, many of them in their late teens and 20s, barricaded themselves inside the facility, demanding safer and more accessible health care for the community.

title: Its Never Too Late to Fall in Love
description: Its Never Too Late is a series that tells the stories of people who decide to pursue their dreams on their own terms.

title: Temple Bar, a Moody Enclave for Martinis, Is Set to Reopen
description: Temple Bar, the clandestine bar on Lafayette Street that served up martinis, mood lighting and a downtown version of uptown glamour until it closed on New Years Eve in 2017, will reopen Thursday. And though the management may be new, it is decidedly loyal to the memory of the original.

title: In China, Home Buyers Who Went All In Say They Want Out
description: China is trying to cool its costly and dangerously debt-ridden housing market, where high prices and go-go levels of borrowing and spending are increasingly seen as a national threat.

title: Afghanistan Is Facing a Total Economic Meltdown
description: When I was traveling around Kabul a few weeks ago, the city felt worlds apart from my last visit in 2019  and not just because a 20-year war had finally ended. The economy is spiraling out of control. And unless money starts flowing soon, a total economic collapse will plunge Afghans into a humanitarian catastrophe.

title: Cant Decide What Color to Paint Your Walls? Theres a Consultant for That.
description: The pandemic has triggered all sorts of upheavals in residential real estate. But whether we stayed in our New York City apartments, or left the city for the suburbs or second homes  and maybe have since returned  we are all spending much more time in our homes.

title: Squid Game Has Made Tracksuits Hot
description: Squid Game, the dystopian South Korean drama that is poised to become Netflixs most-watched show, is, at first glance, an unlikely new entrant into the fashion-tainment complex.

title: Should Passengers Be Vaccinated or Tested to Fly Within the U.S.?
description: By the holiday season, flying will have changed dramatically for Americans returning to the United States from abroad. They will be asked to show proof that they are vaccinated, to commit to two coronavirus tests if they are not and to participate in a new contact tracing system.

title: A Brief Introduction to Philosophy (Through a Certain Sex Act)
description: It was a Monday night in August at the Bell House in Brooklyn, and Jacqueline Novak was sneaking in a few more dates of her hit one-woman show, Get On Your Knees. The 80-minute standup spectacle  which she sometimes must describe, for marketing reasons, as a highbrow show about blowjobs  had just ended its second run Off Broadway. A few days later, it would depart on tour. The crowd that night was girls and gays, plus a handful of older Manhattan-types with an air of having read about the show. Theyd come for provocative and superbly articulate material (The Hollywood Reporter); an overthinkers delight (The New Yorker); a one-woman oral-sex meditation thats part-standup, part-poetic treatise (Vanity Fair).

title: Candace Parker Is the Calm, and the Storm, for the Chicago Sky
description: It was a loaded way to start the W.N.B.A. finals.

title: A Martial Arts Star Is Criticized for His Handling of Abuse Cases
description: In March 2018, a 31-year-old instructor in the martial art of Brazilian jiu-jitsu was arrested at a gym in Naples, Fla. He was charged with three counts of sexual assault of a 16-year-old girl who was one of his students and a close family friend.

title: The Passion of Questlove
description: Most Saturday nights from age 5 to 10, Ahmir Thompson would go to bed at 8 p.m., only to be woken up a few hours later. When he was 3, he had taken a fruit-drink commercial too literally  Hey, how about a nice Hawaiian punch? ended with a fist to his mothers face  so his parents decided to limit his television consumption. But on the weekends, they bent the rules and, around 12:45 a.m., nudged him awake. He would grab his crocheted-by-Grandma blanket and head downstairs, where he would switch on the television, wait for it to warm up and then crank the dial to Channel 48 as quietly as he could. Right at 1 a.m., he was greeted by a magical locomotive  chugging along so rhythmically that it almost seemed to dance, flipping gray buildings it passed into psychedelic colors  for his regular dose of peace, love and Soul Train.

title: As Bike Thefts Jump, Delivery Workers Band Together for Safety
description: Seven nights a week, starting around 9:30, Vicente Carrasco cheers and whistles at food delivery workers as they ride their bicycles into Manhattan after crossing the Queensboro Bridge. The message hes sending? Someones looking out for you.

title: Read the document
Unsolved Murdaugh Murders Expose Years of South Carolina Mysteries
description: HAMPTON, S.C.  Curtis Edward Smith, a handyman and former logger, had done his share of odd jobs over the years for Alex Murdaugh, a lawyer and scion of one of the most powerful legal families in the South Carolina Lowcountry.

title: Governors Race Puts Mask and Vaccines Mandates to a Political Test
description: Six weeks after announcing that grade-school students in New Jersey would again need to wear masks in class, Gov. Philip D. Murphy, a Democrat, issued a new executive order, his 264th: Children 2 and older in day care centers would also have to wear face coverings.

title: The Body Collector of Spain: When Migrants Die at Sea, He Gets Them Home
description: ALGECIRAS, Spain  No one knew the mans name when he washed ashore. His body had floated in the ocean for weeks, and it then sat much of the summer unidentified in a refrigerator in a Spanish morgue.

title: Countries around the globe turn to vaccine mandates to fight coronavirus.
description: In their struggle to convince holdouts to get vaccinated against Covid, governments around the world are embracing vaccine mandates.

title: Thailand proposes easing quarantine rules in a bid to lure New Year tourists.
description: Fully vaccinated travelers from low-risk countries, including the United States and China, would be allowed to visit Thailand without undergoing quarantine starting Nov. 1, under a plan announced by the countrys prime minister, Prayuth Chan-ocha.

title: Is Child Care a Public Responsibility?
description: Many Americans pay more for child care than they do for their mortgages, even though the wages for those who provide the care are among the lowest in the United States.

title: As Big Tech Grows in the Pandemic, Seattle Grows With It
description: The pandemic was a disaster for commercial real estate markets. In the Seattle area, it was a boon.

title: Covid and Age
description: Emily Oster, an economist at Brown University who frequently writes about parenting, published an article in The Atlantic in March that made a lot of people angry. The headline was, Your Unvaccinated Kid Is Like a Vaccinated Grandma. The article argued that Covid-19 tended to be so mild in children that vaccinated parents could feel comfortable going out in the world with their unvaccinated children.

title: The New Jerseys governors race puts mandates to a political test.
description: New Jerseys governors race, which is one of just two governors races in the country before next years midterm elections, is seen by some as an early barometer of voter sentiment.

title: CureVac has withdrawn its Covid vaccine application to European regulators.
description: The German company CureVac announced on Tuesday that it was withdrawing its mRNA vaccine for Covid-19 from the approval process in Europe. The company pulled the plug after determining that it might take until June for regulators to make a ruling about the vaccine.

title: Connor McDavid Is Ready for a Stanley Cup Championship
description: Connor McDavid doesnt lend the comparison much credence.

title: A Designer Who Finds Beauty in Decay
description: ONE OF THE designer Marcin Rusaks lasting memories from his childhood in Poland was spending time in his familys greenhouses. His maternal great-grandfather and grandfather were flower growers in Warsaw and, although their business shuttered just before he was born, he often played in those abandoned, overgrown glass structures. I can still feel the warmth and smell the weeds and bacteria growing there, he says.

title: Weekly News Quiz for Students: Social Media Outage, Nobel Prize, Squid Game
description: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.

title: Harry and Meghan Get into Finance
description: Prince Harry and Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, are getting into the investment business. They are joining Ethic, a fintech asset manager in the fast-growing environmental, social and governance space, as impact partners and investors. Ethic has $1.3 billion under management and creates separately managed accounts to invest in social responsibility themes.

title: In Shanghai, Teahouses Offer Both Community and Solitude
description: THE WOMEN PLAY cards, faces strategically, immaculately bored. Smoke eddies from cigarettes. We are in Huangpu in central Shanghai, a city of some 25 million people  but these six women are the only other customers I see at De He Teahouse, half-hidden on the second floor of a sports complex.

title: The Rich Got Considerably Richer
description: LOS ANGELES  Though it was impossible to see October from the on-deck circle at the All-Star Game in Denver, the future of the Los Angeles Dodgers ever so briefly met the present on that July evening.

title: Samsungs chief, Lee Jae-yong, pleads guilty to a prescription drug charge.
description: The leader of Samsung, Lee Jae-yong, pleaded guilty in Seoul on Tuesday to the illegal use of an anesthetic, the latest chapter in the legal saga of the heir to South Koreas largest conglomerate.

description: Unlike the frenzy that has surrounded nearly every twist and turn in the Theranos saga, the trial of Elizabeth Holmes has been surprisingly mellow.
